data.title: USC in Film and TV – Campus Filming Office
data.text:
USC has been a location of choice for films, TV shows, commercials, print ads and public service announcements for more than 75 years; and has historical ties to the film industry since its inception in Los Angeles in the early 1900’s through to the present day.

The portrayals, views and perspectives expressed or shown in these productions are solely those of the producers and do not necessarily reflect the views and perspectives of the university or any people or units within the university.

You may have seen the campus in these productions:

From The Graduate (Alumni Park Fountain)

From How to Get Away with Murder (Hahn Plaza, Student Union Building)

From City Slickers II (Hoose Library)

In Million Dollar Arm (Dedeaux Field)
